question_title: What will be the value of "Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 6-Month Constant Maturity, Quoted on an Investment Basis" on 2026-02-11?
summary: The 6-month Treasury yield (DGS6MO) is currently at 3.62% and closely anchored to the Fed funds rate (3.50-3.75%). With no FOMC meeting before resolution and high recent stability (3.61-3.63% range), the yield should stay near current levels. The jobs report on Feb 6 is the main catalyst that could move yields 5-15 bps. Strong ISM data provides slight upward bias, but recent labor market weakness creates asymmetric downside risk. Distribution centered at 3.62% with moderate uncertainty reflecting the jobs report and general market noise over 6 trading days.

factors.description: Current yield (3.62%) anchored to Fed funds midpoint (3.625%), no FOMC meeting before resolution
Recent extreme stability (3.61-3.63% range over past week) suggests low volatility environment
Jobs report Feb 6 could move yields 5-15 bps; recent labor weakness suggests downside risk
Strong ISM manufacturing (52.6 vs 48.4 expected) provides mild upward pressure
Tariff/trade uncertainty has moderated recently, reducing tail risk
Kevin Warsh Fed nomination signals continued gradual easing path
